title: Epitaph for Markia Loukilia
support: Three joining fragments of marble plaque, set in plaster in modern times.

handNote.lettering: “Scrittura corsiveggiante alla latina” (Korhonen). Lunate Ε (at l. 5, but quadrate at l. 4) and Σ, cursive Ω. Α, Λ and Μ with serifs, Κ with short arms. Open triangle-shaped interpunct at l. 3.

date._: 1st century CE or first half of 2nd century CE

provenanceFound._: Original discovery not recorded. Registered in the anonymous codex Marucellianus A 77 f. 142v: the inscription was “fortasse non Catanensis tamen Siculus” according to Kaibel due to the Doric expression χρηστά. From a linguistic and palaeographic point of view, the inscription is considered from Catania by Korhonen (cf. CIL 10.7056).

provenanceObserved._: Observed by Torremuzza and Kaibel in Museo del Monastero di San Nicolò l’Arena, later by Korhonen in magazzino del Cortile, Collezione dei Benedettini, formerly sala VI, 109.
